results.title: Large language model - Wikipedia
results.content: A large language model (LLM) is a language model trained withself-supervised machinelearningon a vast amount of text, designed for natural language processing tasks, especially language generation. [1][2] The largest and most capable LLMs are generative pre-trained transformers (GPTs) and provide the core capabilities of modern chatbots.

results.title: Into the Unknown: Self-Learning Large Language Models
results.content: We address the main problem ofself-learningLLM: the question of what to learn. We propose aself-learningLLM framework that enables an LLM to independently learn previously unknown knowledge throughself-assessment of their own hallucinations. We introduce a concept called Point in the Unknown (PiU) to identify atomic knowledge unknown to a model, along with four methods for automatic PiUs ...

results.title: Teaching large language models how to absorb new knowledge
results.content: Humans know how to learn new information, but large language models can't do this in the same way. Once a fully trained LLM has been deployed, its "brain" is static and can't permanently adapt itself to new knowledge.

results.title: The Role of Self-Supervised Learning in LLM Development
